title: [BEAM-10603] Add max count to utils.to_element_list
body:
Change-Id: I9a2fbf1532b3d22a612e7a09f4f1fb2b9635c40b PR 4/7 Reading elements from cache can yield TestStreamFileRecords which can have many elements that exceeds the requested element count. This also adds functionality to decode more types of elements (WindowedValueHolder and "Any"). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10603] Add ElementLimiters to all Cache Managers.
body:
Change-Id: I093e1dc1f99c31b1e0bb868fc3bcfc507bd24c8d PR 3/7 This builds on https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12411 to utilize the ElementLimiters to stop reading from cache. This also adds the ability for caches to clear single PCollections. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10603] Add ElementLimiters which allows the cache to prematurely based on read elements.
body:
Change-Id: I9f7030999f2ce38073ca72512c71794dbdbc301e PR 2/7 This will allow for the cache to stop reading based on elements. Currently, the cache can only stop based on global configuration. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10603] Gracefully stop the TestStream RPC if the job stops.
body:
Change-Id: I1b25694c2f8f52d5335da889610ae1871deb0917 PR 1/7 When the DirectRunner gets canceled, there is no signal to pass to the evaluation context to gracefully shut it down. The TestStreamImpl starts a long-lived GRPC thread that needs to be terminated when the runner shuts down. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Enable all Jenkins jobs triggering for committers
body:
PR https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12319 introduced an issue that prevents anyone from triggering seed jobs and dependency check job from GitHub pull requests. That PR fixes the issue and makes it available for all beam committers. Other jobs are not affected and still can be triggered by anyone. At the same time `apache` GitHub organization is removed from GHPRB plugin admins. Apache LDAP server is used as a source of the beam committers' GitHub usernames. The seed job is extended to fetch the usernames and populate GHPRB user whitelists for the jobs that are not publically triggerable. ______________ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10591] Fix flaky xlang jdbc test
body:
Jdbc cross-language python test is flaky due to testcontainer's boot failure. I added retries to starting the container as it is in testcontainer's java sdk for Postgres and ignore the exception if it was raised in stop() function in the test's tearDown. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10559] Add apache_beam.examples.sql_taxi

title: Disable checker in Java 11 builds
body:
This works around kelloggm/checkerframework-gradle-plugin#117 The plugin bases its configuration in part on what JVM Gradle runs during configuration, which is JRE8 currently. Specifically it sets -Xbootclasspath/p seemingly because: - the Gradle JVM used during configure is version 8 - the source level is 8 - Checker version is >= 3 Fix TBD but likely a minor change to the plugin. Since checker is a source-level analysis we do not need to run it redundantly in Java 11 builds. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Improve beam CreateList test coverage

title: [BEAM-9839] OnTimerContext should not create a new one when processing each element/timer in FnApiDoFnRunner

title: [BEAM-10587] Support Maps in BigQuery
body:
Maps are currently not supported when converting a Beam Schema to a BigQuery TableFieldSchema. This improvement will convert Maps to repeated records with 'key' and 'value' fields. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Upgrade spotbugs from 3.1.12 to 4.0.6, spotbugs gradle plugin from 2.0.0 to 3.0.0
body:
This PR: - upgrades the Spotbugs plugin to the most recent that works with our version of Gradle [1] - upgrades Spotbugs to the latest [2] - inlines most of `spotbugs-filter.xml` to annotations on the code it is about [3] Read footnotes if you care about why... [1] In #12376 removing rawtypes created new Spotbugs null errors in the expansion service module. But checker is enabled there, so Spotbugs is irrelevant. So I went down a rabbit hole of trying to pass `omitVisitors` to disable the null-related checks via the Spotbugs gradle plugin. I upgraded the plugin to get it working. [2] Just randomly in my attempt to get the above working, I also tried upgrading Spotbugs. It caught a bunch of new errors and seemed mostly useful to upgrade. So I decided to do it. [3] I realized I don't need `omitVisitors` and it is very mysterious indeed, and it was better to suppress the relevant errors in the `spotbugs-filter.xml`. But that file was also full of suppressions that shouldn't be suppressed (like default encoding dependence) and also individual suppressions that should be next to the code. So I refactored that. Note that the new Spotbugs found _tons_ of null errors everywhere in the code, since the old version of Spotbugs was so bad at catching them. It doesn't make sense to fix those since the best thing to do is just enable checker which understands generics and it not heuristic. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10527] Migrate Flink and Spark tests to pytest.
body:
# Motivation The main goals of migrating to pytest are: 1. Get Junit structured test output (BEAM-10527). 2. Replace PortableRunnerTest's bespoke timeout mechanism with pytest's (BEAM-9011). ~This also implicitly raises the timeout for all these tests from 60s to 600s, which should reduce the likelihood of timeout flakes (BEAM-8912).~ # Implementation I originally wanted to do this in incremental changes, but I gradually realized a complete overhaul of these tests' configuration was needed. The main challenge was that `flink_runner_test.py` expected to be run as `__main__`, which is impossible with pytest. I basically reworked everything except the tests themselves; the tests themselves are unchanged. ## Test parametrization - I left worker configuration in Gradle because it changes the test dependencies. I moved optimization and streaming into `flink_runner_test.py` because it removes the need to set up separate tox tasks, separate test result files, etc. - Since `flink_job_server_driver`, `environment_type`, and `environment_config` are all pipeline options, I decided to pass them to `flink_runner_test.py` by introducing a global pytest option, `--test-pipeline-options`. `nose` uses `--test-pipeline-options` for integration tests, so I figured this would be generally useful beyond just these tests in the future. # Bonus trivia Prior to this change, we were running the exact same streaming test suite *four times* per Jenkins run. Every `flinkCompatibilityMatrix` task ran the entirety of `flink_runner_test.py` which contained two classes: `FlinkRunnerTest` and `FlinkRunnerTestOptimized`. `FlinkRunnerTestOptimized` was basically the same thing as `FlinkRunnerTest`, but it added the `pre_optimize=all` experiment and skipped external transform tests, since the Python optimizer breaks external transforms (BEAM-7252). But we were *also* adding `pre_optimize=all` in Gradle, redundantly. The old configuration looks like this: ```groovy dependsOn flinkCompatibilityMatrix(streaming: false, workerType: CompatibilityMatrixConfig.SDK_WORKER_TYPE.LOOPBACK) dependsOn flinkCompatibilityMatrix(streaming: true, workerType: CompatibilityMatrixConfig.SDK_WORKER_TYPE.LOOPBACK) dependsOn flinkCompatibilityMatrix(streaming: true, workerType: CompatibilityMatrixConfig.SDK_WORKER_TYPE.LOOPBACK, preOptimize: true) ``` Notice that pre-optimized batch is missing. This is because `flinkCompatibilityMatrixBatchPreOptimize*` would run `FlinkRunnerTest` with `pre_optimize=all` but without skipping the external transform tests, causing failure. What about streaming, then? Well, the optimizer *doesn't affect streaming pipelines at all*: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/489cf2cbf335f372060469953ed7599f2838a591/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/portability/portable_runner.py#L319 So in one invocation of `flinkValidatesRunner`, `flinkCompatibilityMatrixStreamingLoopback` would run `FlinkRunnerTest` (without `pre_optimize=all`) and `FlinkRunnerTestOptimized`, then `flinkCompatibilityMatrixStreamingPreOptimizeLoopback` would run `FlinkRunnerTest` (with `pre_optimize=all`) and `FlinkRunnerTestOptimized` (with `pre_optimize=all` twice). Besides the skips in `FlinkRunnerTestOptimized`, all four tests would be doing the exact same thing. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: GH-Actions workflow checks are GCP variables set [depends on BEAM-10599]
body:
I want to propose a different approach for making GitHub Actions workflow runnable on the forks. Some of the jobs requires GCP variables stored as secrets to perform operations like uploading wheels to GCS. Currently these jobs are filtered based on the condition `github.repository_owner == 'apache'`. I introduced shell script which checks are these variables are set and echos some information about them. Later job filtering is based on the output returned by this check. PR which introduced gating: [Gate GH actions so it only runs in main/upstream repo](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12222) Inspired by Apache Airflow ci workflow: https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L111 Depends on depends on https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12405 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Cleanup WordCount example.
body:
I saw this when looking at another example. Our first and most prominent example really should follow best practices. * Use standard "with Pipeline" convention. * Use MapTuple rather than Map and manual tuple unpacking. * Use recommended combine patter rather than DoFn. * Remove advanced metrics feature from first example. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10575] Eliminate legacy rawtypes from GCP IOs and some others; enable -Wrawtypes -Werror
body:
This removes the use of rawtypes, a legacy concept, from GPC IOs. Aside from readability and good hygiene, this is important because rawtypes also impede other analyses (see https://checkerframework.org/manual/#generics-raw-types) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10545] KernelModel and jest tests
body:
1. Added a KernelModel module that handles messaging between the frontend and the connected kernel. The model silently executes code in the kernel and handles IOPub responses from the kernel for information of the current interactive environment. UI components and other data models can use this module as a data model to communicate with the kernel. When instantiated, this model does not have to be a singleton. 2. Integrated jest test framework with typescript. 3. Advanced prettier to 1.19 so that it can parse typescript optional chaining syntax. 4. The tests can be executed with `jlpm jest`. Test details see README. 5. Changes made by jlpm are: jlpm add --dev jest @types/jest ts-jest identity-obj-proxy jlpm upgrade prettier@^1.19.0 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10564] Support more Avro field name formats when mapping to Java fields
body:
a fields When mapping Avro schema field names to the related generated Java class fields, Beam currently supports Avro field names like field_name and fieldName. This improvement will add support for Avro field names like FieldName and FIELD_NAME. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: python nexmark query 0-2 improvements
body:
changed parser and serialization code to use the same json format to represent models, added auction_price model and corrected the behavior of query 0 - 2 to align with the nexmark specification. created field_name file to map the fieldnames with string literals in json representation. created nexmark_query_util to put transforms that gets reused across different queries. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10567] Updating etcd dependency in gogradle.lock
body:
Looks like etcd's github repo changed from https://github.com/coreos/etcd to https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd. That may be the source of the :sdks:go:resolveBuildDependencies in the PythonDocker precommits recently, so hopefully this fixes that. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10562]Eliminate nullability errors from :sdks:java:extensions:join-library
body:

title: [BEAM-10240] Support ZetaSQL DATETIME functions in BeamSQL
body:
__This PR adds support of all ZetaSQL DATETIME functions to BeamSQL:__ - CURRENT_DATETIME - EXTRACT - DATETIME - DATETIME_ADD - DATETIME_SUB - DATETIME_DIFF - DATETIME_TRUNC - FORMAT_DATETIME - PARSE_DATETIME `DATE_FROM_DATETIME()`, `TIME_FROM_DATETIME()`, `TIMESTAMP_FROM_DATETIME()` and `EXTRACT_DATETIME_FROM_TIMESTAMP` are also supported. r: @apilloud @robinyqiu ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix typos on programming-guide.md
body:
A spelling error in programming-guide.md was bothering me. Wanted to make it better for everyone. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10558] Flushing of buffered elements during checkpoint can stall
body:
Elements are buffered during `DoFnOperator#snapshotState`, called as part of a Flink checkpoint. This is necessary because flushing out elements in this method call would alter the checkpoint barrier alignment. Optionally, elements can be flushed out before the method call via the `finishBundleBeforeCheckpointing` option which is turned off by default because it can affect the checkpoint duration. The buffer is flushed as part of starting a new bundle. A problem arises if no new bundle will be started. For example, this can be the case if only a single element (e.g. Impulse) is produced as part of a bundle during checkpointing. Afterwards, when no bundle will be started due to another element arriving, or a timer firing, the element will not be flushed from the buffer. title: [BEAM-10169] Relax ParDo# test
body:
The test ends up being brittle if the package is vendored, so removing most of the package path from the check validates the important parts, but allows the vendoring paths to succeed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Interactive: clean up when pipeline is out of scope
body:
1. Completed the cleanup routine for all internal states held by the current interactive environment. 2. Utilized the environment inspector to determine whether a pipeline is out of scope: not assigned to variable and has no inspectable PCollections. 3. Invoked the cleanup every time the user defined pipelines in watched scope are refreshed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10601] DICOM API Beam IO connector
body:
Create a new Apache Beam I/O connector that helps customers facilitate the reading and writing data to the DICOM Healthcare API, it has three components: 1. An Ptransform that takes QIDO request and output result metadata as pcollection. 2. An I/O sink that takes DICOM files and writes them to DICOM store via API. 3. An Ptransform that convert pubsub message to Qido search request.. ------------------------ R:@pabloem, CC:@dranderson1117,@DanKotowski Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10274] Don't use JSON for --beam_services value
body:
JSON objects are not properly handled when sent to a portable worker and end up crashing the worker. This PR changes beam_services to use the format `--beam_service :module:task=/path/to/something.jar` to avoid this issue. title: [BEAM-10545] Initialize an empty extension
body:
1. Files were generated from: cookiecutter https://github.com/jupyterlab/extension-cookiecutter-ts. 2. Modifications are done to swap in Apache-2.0 license and add supplemental instructions in README. 3. .eslint* and .prettier* files are for formatting and linting, details seen in README. 4. This is a node package, thus package.json. 5. This package is written in TypeScript, thus tsconfig.json. 6. Sources are located in src/* and CSS are located in style/*. 7. `jlpm` is an alias of `yarn` locked by JupyterLab. Dependencies are managed by `yarn`, thus yarn.lock. 8. The empty extension, when activated, logs something in console when JupyterLab is started. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10543] Upgrade Kafka cross-language python tests
body:

title: [BEAM-10540] Migrate to checker annotations and properly annotate Object#equals overrides
body:
This PR includes independent commits that: - excludes generated `AutoValue` classes - port the codebase to checker annotations so that types can be annotated properly and move annotations adjacent to the types that they are annotating (before Java 8 this was not possible but now it results in a warning if we do not do it) - annotate overrides of `equals` to note that the argument is nullable I did not try to fix nullability errors in `equals` methods because the PR is big enough as it is, and stands alone. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10512] adds parsedData member variable to HL7v2Message and a Builder for the class
body:
Added parsedData member variable to HL7v2Message to allow non-schematized parsing customers to use the HL7v2IO connector With adding additional nullable member variable, a Builder was also added to the class for creating new instances. To support this new member variable, the HL7v2MessageCoder was updated to support the ParsedData class and a coder was created for ParsedData class. In addition, 2 unit tests were added to test coder functionality and validate that the new member variable does not break existing functionality. R: @lukecwik ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10510] fix potential NPE in UnboundedSourceWrapper#close
body:
Closes [BEAM-10510]. The source can apparently be closed prior to being opened. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix uploading wheels to GCS (on github actions)

title: [BEAM-10533] Remove watermark hold from RequiresTimeSortedInput
body:
Do not setup watermark hold for new data. Clear the hold when not empty. The hold should be completely removed in some future release, when we can consider all pipelines to be upgraded to recent version. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Implement Nth Value
body:
Concept-proof implementation of nth-value. Currently, an java.io.EOFException exception is thrown. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
